intro: Bleasdalea cupanoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Bleasdalea cupanoides is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
